intro: Pachystoma lindleyanum, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its robust, shrub-like growth habit with thick, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a violet or purple base. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand extreme heat and drought conditions. Pachystoma lindleyanum is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
